- Bacon kimchi deviled eggs - if you like deviled eggs, these are a must try. The kimichi isn't overpowering.
- Bone Marrow: Whoa! This was soooo good. We asked for extra bread to sop up all the deliciousness.
- Pork Chop: Cooked perfectly and delicious!
- Lamb shank: the clear winner! Definitely order this - it's amazing! Flavorful and tender.
author: Michelle V.

description: Everything we had was so salty! The food would have been perfect if they just laid off the salt. We had the deviled eggs, lamb dish, yellow tail collar and bone marrow. Deviled eggs were really good but was really salty. Lamb was delicious. The meat fell right off the bones but the sauce was very salty.  Yellow tail collar was beautifully presented but it wasn't very fresh and the sauce was also too salty for my liking. I love eating fish so I could tell it wasn't very fresh. It had a fishy taste to it. The bone marrow was good probably the least saltiest thing we had. I had better marrow but it's decent. I drank about 6 glasses of water after we were done. We left hungry because we couldn't stand eating more sodium rich foods. The staff was very attentive maybe a little too attentive. I for one don't like to be asked how my food is every 5 minutes.
author: Carmen L.

description: I had my 30th Birthday there this weekend and per usual the food was outstanding! All 20 of my friends were super impressed! Can't wait to come back!
author: Irina M.

description: I just finished dinner and HAD to write a quick review-- we were casually walking down 24th street on an impromptu night in SF and saw a crowd of people through a restaurant window which stirred up our curiosity. We thought "what the hey let's just get a drink" given that neither of us were hungry. We walked in and decided to sit at the bar despite their table availability as per our decision to merely get a glass of wine. At the bar, I ordered a champagne cocktail and my fiancé ordered one of their aperitifs. Both drinks were absolutely wonderful and with our current state of awe we gave in and indulged on some food, yet share plates. We chose wisely and selected the little gem lettuce salad, the pan roasted black cod, and the orange-almond cake, respectively. As each plate arrived, we took in what we thought to be a very delicious concoction of foods and flavors. The little gem salad was to die for! If only they had a branch in Los Angeles, I'd come for this salad! The dressing was exquisite and the pairings of bitters and watery crisps combined with nuts and pears was so memorable. They did a stellar job on that. The cod was beyond anything I've ever had. The fish just melted in my mouth and I was sad when the fish was fully devoured as I stared at an empty plate reminiscing on the fish that once laid there. If I could just go back in time and re-eat it... Lastly, the orange almond cake was the most interesting. We realized you had to spread the fraiche the cake before you ate it. It's a combined flavor. Once we figured that out, it was again, an interesting success. We ended our meal with a digestif, I can't remember which one. The service was impeccable, the food was award worthy and the night was perfect for a calm, first night in San Francisco.  If I could come back, I will. For all of those who reside here- you must keep returning. Til next time...
author: Faith O.

description:
We had a 7:45 reservation for a group of 7 and we were not sat down till about 8:15pm. We were pretty upset because the reasoning was just like "who knows when that table before you will leave" and I get it but I don't... Perhaps they saw the hanger in our faces but they gave us some complimentary apps while we waited and that helped ease the pain. The apps were some toast, and deviled eggs both pretty decent. 
They had a delicious Vietnamese inspired crab spring roll as a special that night.  Apart from it being a roll, it wasn't that Vietnamese but the crab was plentiful and it was tasty.  
The large plates were hearty and delicious. I had the lamb shank which was soft and falling off the bone. I got a taste of the pork and burger + fries from other people at the table and both were also really good. 
I'd definitely try it out one more time because while the everything else is not fantastic, the food was really good.
author: Veronica L.

description: Unfortunately, despite a good service it was very disappointing. The appetizer was very good but the rest of the meal was not good at all: it was way too acidic to the point that I wondered if the chef really tasted his meal altogether. I might give it another try but I was quite disappointed
author: Bouguen A.

description: What an absolute gem! We were a party of six with a 6:15pm reservation. The space was light and bright and clean. Even though the restaurant filled up, we could hear each other and carry on a conversation across the table. Our waitress was super attentive and took order as soon as we were ready, filled wine and brought additional drinks exactly when needed, and the various courses came out perfectly timed. But the highlight of everything was the food! Such delicious, bright, and fresh flavors. And beautifully plated. We will be back again as soon as possible! It was the best meal I've had in SF in months.
author: Melissa C.

description: I want their tuna tostadas everyday, all day! Had the fried chicken sandwich for brunch and left beyond happy and extremely full. However, wasn't full enough to not try all of their desserts. The waffle with orange zest butter is beyond amazing! So happy this place is only a half a block away from my apartment.
author: Samantha E.

description:
I had a meal here last night and really enjoyed it.  I came late and on my own, so I got an instant seat at the bar.  The service was very good at the bar - I would no sooner finish a glass or a plate and they would ask if I wanted anything else.  My food came very quickly - I was still sipping on my glass of white when my burger came.  I ordered:

* 1 deviled egg: $2.50
* 1 burger + fries: $16.00
* 2 glasses of wine $10-15 per glass
* salted caramel chocolate chip cookies: $6
* amaro: $6

The deviled egg was a little bight of bliss.  At this price point I'm comparing it to an oyster, and it stood up nicely and definitely got my appetite going.

The burger is rich, but simple.  In this burger the toppings are only there accent the meat, which in my case was cooked perfectly.  There are no tomatoes, or raw onions to stand out - just a delicious aeoli-based sauce and some chopped iceberg lettuce for texture.  The result is a burger that feels a bit like a steak from a steakhouse, literally dripping with umami.  You'll need to soak the sauce up with your fries.

On the cookies: they're heavy on the chocolate chips, and baked fresh, so the chocolate is melted inside.  Good luck keeping your hands clean.  I was searching the menu for a desert wine and saw the amaro option, which I recommend if you enjoy digestifs.

Everything I ordered was simple, but well executed.  I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Thomas R.

description: This Business is a farce the amount of food given for the price is ridiculous especially in the appetisers ther fony tostada bites 2 pieces I could have bought a bag of tostito an avocado  good service lousy ffood the bustos bisquet what a joke and the chilequiles cheap food for high prices
author: Cindy D.

description:
While the interior is nice and the menu looks appealing, we had an appalling service experience that spoils this restaurant for us

When our entree arrived on our table, the table next to us insisted that the food was actually theirs - to our surprise, the runner agreed and actually moved the food off our table onto theirs.  I would have expected in any other restaurant that they would have left us the dish and remedied the neighbors' issue separately.

After we made eye contact with the waitress, who was being filled in on the situation, she loudly and brusquely asked "do you have something to say to me". We had to recount the situation to her while our neighbors seated very close by listened. The manager then came over to try and smooth things over and offered to bring us a glass of wine, which both didn't arrive (had to be ordered again) and wasn't comped (though in fairness, the disputed dish ended up being removed).  The rest of the meal was so uncomfortable after having this "argument" with the table next to us, made worse that we had to wait another 15 minutes without food for the dish that had already been on our table before.

We were initially excited by the menu and by a new restaurant in our neighborhood, but we won't be back to any restaurant that treats their guests so tactlessly.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5 all around but what bumped it up to 4 stars is 1) because Yelp doesn't have half stars and 2) my husband and I were hungry, in the area and were able to walk-in and have a solid meal. 

We started with the grilled octopus with yucca and olives and it was a very hearty portion and super savory and delicious. We then shared the pork chop and black cod. I loved the fish. I am not a huge fan of mole and so it overwhelmed the pork dish for me (and was hard to eat around) but my husband really like it. 

If we lived in the neighborhood, I think this would be a spot we would enjoy re-visiting. It was great value and overall everything was tasty.
author: Molly S.

description:
This place is amazing! Try the bone marrow!!
Super friendly staff and amazing food! I love this place
author: Brittany K.

description: Great place for a night out. Good drinks and good ambiance. Small plates are great to share and try several options: octopus, mushrooms and tartare highly recommended
author: Maria P.

description:
The ingredients used at this restaurant are typical for San Francisco brunch places.  The food itself is an assembly / basic cooking of the ingredients - nothing more, nothing less.  

I would have had a much better experience if our water (Charles N) didn't voluntarily suggest alternatives from the menu when I was placing my order.  Throughout lunch, I witnessed the waiter voluntarily offer alternatives to the tables to both my left and right.  The waiter seemed to have specific alternatives he personally preferred over every dish.  It was a pattern of "Oh, if you're thinking of getting ____, you should get the ____ instead.  It's a similar dish, but MUCH better."  In reality, he was simply trying to sway people towards dishes that fit his personal taste.  

I was excited to order the crushed avocado toast, and instead, the waiter suggested I ordered the tuna & avocado tostadas.  He said the only difference was one came with tuna, and was a lot more flavorful.  What he did not mention, was that the tostadas would literally be two 1-bite crackers, whereas the avocado toast is a full-sized thick toaste, topped with a generous amount of avocado.  When it arrived, the table to our left quickly cancelled their tostada order, commenting that they had no idea the waiter had swayed them into ordering 2 small bites, at basically the same price.  

I'm sure the waiter had every best intention in mind, but at a certain point, the restaurant needs to train their staff to differentiate between providing input on dish suggestions, vs. trying to sway the customer in other directions without providing sufficient details. 

Later, the waiter asked us how we liked the tostadas.  I told him I would have much preferred the avocado toast because of its size (we were hoping to share the dish as an appetizer for the table), and also the taste.  The miniscule amount of diced tuna added virtually nothing in flavor to the crackers + almost translucent spread of avocado on top of the 2-inch diameter cracker.  VERY little for a dish that's over $10.  His only response was "Oh, I'm sorry you didn't like it."

The waiter made no attempt to offer a solution.

Later, another waiter asked me if I'd like to order anything to drink.  I asked if they had mint tea, to which he said yes and took down the order.  20 minutes later, I followed up on the status of the tea, since I was almost finished with breakfast, and the waiter said "oh yeah, I didn't bring it out because I found out we don't carry mint tea." . . . wouldn't you think they should approach me with that information, as opposed to just not following up on an order?

Advice to management: Better train your staff to meet the expectations of standard brunch service in San Francisco.
author: Colette C.

description:
Found this restaurant on Eater's new Heat Map for November 2017 (https://sf.eater.com/maps/best-new-restaurants-san-francisco-oakland-berkeley-heatmap). My bf and I wanted to eat at a new restaurant that wouldn't break the bank for a casual Fri night, and having looked at the menu ahead of time, it looked pretty decent.

Food:
Overall, pretty good food, but also nothing super exciting that stood out. 
-Tuna and uni tostada - ($10) probably our favorite dish. Tuna tartare type dish with small chip tostada, great but small.
-Brussel Sprouts Panzanela ($10) - warm brussel sprout salad with yellow beets, goat cheese and sour dough. This was a good dish, but also tasted like something we could make at home. Beets were great, sour dough had a chewy inside with crispy outside, and brussel sprouts nice and tender.
-Pork Chop ($22) - my bf liked the flavor for it. 
-Pan roasted black cod ($20) - I liked it, simple dish though.

Value:
This restaurant has excellent value, for the style of the dishes. This is quite a rarity in SF these days. Our total bill came out to maybe $80, and with tax/tip, less than 50 a person. Wow. This included 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and corkage of $20. 

Service:
You can tell that although their service is very friendly, they are all new to the restaurant business, and don't really know what they're doing yet. My bf brought a bottle of wine from home. They didn't tell us about the corkage fee (we always expect to pay regardless), and also when our waiter tried to open our bottle at the table, he broke our cork. They took our bottle away, and after 15 mins our bottle returned - they had to use a cheesecloth to get the wine out. I mean, things like this don't really bother me too much, but it just shows their staff isn't really trained in the restaurant industry. This situation would have never happened at Nopa, etc. Also, after we were done with our appetizer, a bus boy took away our share plates, and gave us new share plates. Then our entree arrived, and the waiter had to say to us, "can you move the plates? Thank you." Again, these small little things don't really matter to me, but show that the owner hasn't really thought of the cadence of restaurant flow, or perhaps staff has not been adequately trained yet. 

Ambiance: 
Looks really cute when you walk in, but once you sit down you begin to notice that this restaurant feels that it was built on a budget. My booth seat was fine, but my bf complained of sitting on a flimsy chair the whole night. Also, we were seated at a regular table right by the bar seating, and there was very tight clearance between my bf's seat and the bar seating. Thus, the whole meal consisted of a lot of people trying to get through to the bathroom, waiters trying to clear tables and get through, customers trying to get to their table - while bumping into my bf's chair the whole night. 

Verdict:
Overall, our prediction is that this restaurant won't be able to survive. Also, if you're not a foodie, or really into great value when dining out, you might like this restaurant a lot. But if you are a big restaurant-goer like myself, you might think otherwise.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
For a place that's been open just a few weeks (3 when we dined), Son's is phenomenal - what a fabulous addition to our favorite SF neighborhood, the Mission. For SF, a city of snooty and smug waitstaff, the service was really outstanding - a special thanks to Anna who is one of the owners, for paying serious attention to a food allergy and saving us a painful evening. The food is fantastic, especially for the price. Those 2 elements plus a cozy and charming interior make it 5 star. We had a truly great birthday dinner here, for 3 people (including a young teen) and ordered tons of food and wine - for maybe $180. We've eaten at many spectacular restaurants across the US and around the world, and we think Son's is a serious contender for greatness. (Just don't get too big for your boots and lose the fabulous service!)

Contrary to comments from another poster, the couple who own Son's are very experienced SF restaurant folks who've held positions at Marlowe, Maverick, Anzu, Jardiniere, etc. It shows. The Brussels sprouts dish, the mushrooms, the pate, and the burger were delectable. Our favorite was the lamb shank - soooo good - but there was one misstep, the polenta in that dish was horribly cheesy and all wrong for the shank. Unsophisticated. The only misstep of the meal. 

The cookies are super good - and when we didn't order dessert because we were all too full, they just gave us some with a birthday candle. Very nice touch. 

Note that this area of 24th is filled with fun little stores and taco spots and a couple of okay bars, but actually kind of limited if you arrive early and want to grab a drink. And you'll definitely want to make a res - it was jam packed by 6:30 on the Sat we were there, and stayed crushed until we left at 9+.  Keep up the good work Son's!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Son's Addition is a phenomenal newcomer to the 24th St Corridor. We were thrilled with the charming atmosphere and the delectable creations from chef Nick Cobarruvias. This spot delivers
adventurous, eclectic flavors in a setting that manages to be both lively and low-key. The tuna and uní tostadas were a bite of joy, the hen-of-the-woods mushrooms were a rich vegetarian option, and the cod was a beautifully balanced main! 

- Nice selection of wine and beer
- Friendly, attentive service 
- Reasonable prices
- Delicious food that made us want to plan our next visit!!
author: Jasmine D.

description: I was delighted to discover Son's Addition while meandering through the Mission district.  The chef has a great sense of balance, while offering an innovative menu.  All my dishes were outstanding, and the service was well above par.  I'll be back soon!
author: Frank S.

description:
This was our first time at Son's Addition. The experience was uneven but we'll definitely go back. The food was delicious, but some of the most intriguing ingredients (the kimchee in the deviled eggs and the kimchee romesco with the black cod) were undetectable. Our wines (a Fiddlehead rosé and an Amplify red) were lovely. The service was charming but uneven. It took a long time to get waited on, and one course went missing. Our server more than made up for it by apologizing and comping some items. My only real complaint is about the noise level -- it is not a place for a quiet conversation. Some sound baffling would be a huge help. 

I agree with Michael Bauer's review in the SF Chronicle, though I'd give the place 3 stars (on their 4-star scale) rather than 2.5. (https://www.sfchronicle.com/restaurants/diningout/article/Son-s-Addition-a-big-plus-for-S-F-dining-12416150.php)
author: Robert W.

description:
This place is a special find. We originally thought we were attending a special meal prepared By an Iranian chef, but we  discovered we were a day late. We decided to stay and sample their regular menu, and boy are we glad we did.

Three of us sampled four of their "small" plates and one of their entrees. I put the word small in quotes because they were no such thing. Every plate was enough for each of us to enjoy a nice sized helping. All of the dishes were unique and exceedingly tasty. 

The Octopus was so tender I could not imagine how they did it. The Hen in the Woods mushrooms were the best I've ever had. The beef tartar was good but a bit ordinary. And, my mother never learned how to make a Brussel Sprout dish like they made here. I LOVED it. 

By the time the Amberjack main dish arrived, it was almost too much food. But it too was delicious. 

Prices were reasonable. With three glasses of wine, coffee and one dessert the bill was $150 + tip. I can't recommend this place highly enough. Go try it and see for yourself.
author: Harris M.

description:
AMAZING SERVICE AND DELICIOUS FOOD.

They fold your napkins every time you go to the restroom, and held the door while we exited ^.^ What an amazing EXPERIENCE! Thank you!
author: THUY N.

description:
Love this new place!
The atmosphere is very nice, the design is very well made!
The food.. delicious! They are using products that you don't know like the yucca! 
The size of the portion are pretty large!! The beetroot salad was definitely my favorite one.
The service is great!
I recommend highly to reserve a table in advance :)
author: Geraldine F.

description:
I really enjoyed Son's Addition, though I wasn't absolutely blown away by it. We were looking for a new spot to grab dinner with a friend who was in town, and it was just a short hop from Noe Valley where we were hanging out. We decided to call and ask for a reservation to pop in here -- which we got one, though it was later at night.

The first thing I noticed was that the place is definitely a loud one. We had a lot of trouble just hearing each other talk across the table, and it seems to have that kind of feedback loop where it gets louder and louder as people start yelling to overhear each other. The kitchen is exposed to the rest of the restaurant, so you can peek over and see what's happening behind the scenes. The aesthetic of the place is great and the staff is pretty attentive, but it can just feel pretty hectic at times.

The dishes were definitely on the pricier side. They're kind of the price levels you'd expect for a higher-end restaurant like Saru or Foreign Cinema in San Francisco, but I felt like the atmosphere and quality of the meal just didn't sum up to other comparably priced restaurants. We ordered the Kimchi deviled eggs, which were delicious, but in the end just seemed like an unnecessary splurge. The rest of the meal was good, but not so amazing that I would walk home and remember the meal fondly and crave it a lot in a few months.

There's nothing particularly bad about this place other than the noise level, and the food is in the sort of A- range, but I think the price was a little high given the return on spend. I'd recommend it in a pinch if you're looking for something upscale, but otherwise do your research when you're planning your big celebrations -- and make sure you have reservations.
author: Matthew L.

description: Exquisite flavors. Outstanding people. Inventive chef. A San Francisco "must". Went here with friends from out of town. And we all agreed it was one of the best meals of the weekend.
author: Al S.

description:
Incredibly creative food combinations. Delicious! I had the hamachi and the uni and tuna tostada to start, followed by the lamb shank. Every item was perfectly cooked. I really appreciated the spice and the herbs combo in the hamachi dish. Could have eaten three more orders of that! 
The wine list was refreshing! Unpretentious, accessible and fun. I could actually navigate it, and probably had the best wine/food pairings in years. Definitely going back.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I very much wanted to like this place. The food was well-executed throughout, with one major caveat - every dish was salted to the point of inedibility. From the starters to each of my party's mains, nothing was spared the heavy hand. There was also a bottle of wine incorrectly categorized on the wine list, which - while insignificant on its face - speaks to the broader lack of attention to detail.

Maybe next time.
author: Darren M.

description: Good drinks, good ambiance, and even better food. Deviled eggs, steak tartare, liver mousse, bone marrow were on point!
author: Jules C.

description: Awesome place for a casual dinner but with an incredible menu, amazing service and competitive prices.  The burger was among the best ever along with the grouper collar.  I will definitely be back and bringing friends to try this new neighborhood gem.  Opportunity for improvement on the desert side but with everything else being so great - that is not a deal breaker.
author: Michael C.

description: Love each meal we've had there - each bite is perfectly composed, light and delicate, the service is friendly, the menu creative.
author: Arielle K.

description: Awesome to have such a spot like this so close to my home. The food is so damn tasty and is matched by the friendliness of the staff, a tone set by Anna and Nick, the fine hosts. I have a 19-month old and they're super accommodating of her and us. Great, great, great local spot.
author: Dave R.

description: Amazing restaurant. The food was delicious and the service impeccable. The hostess (wife of the chef and co-owner) recommended all our dishes.  So glad we took her advice. We loved everything we ate.  The restaurant has a lot of heart and great energy. I felt at home eating there (only no one in my home can cook anything even remotely as delicious). Eat here. It rocks.
author: Marilyn C.

description: The restaurant is cute and some of the dishes we ordered were amazing. The gen of the woods mushrooms were amazing and my friends vegetable scramble looked fantastic. The avocado toast however was really disappointing. There was only a very little amount of avocado and it felt like they topped it with arugula and fennel to hide that. I had to ask for extra avocado because it felt like I was just eating toast with salad.
author: Michelle L.

description: Food was delicious- we started with beef tartare, bone marrow, and deviled eggs. All really yummy and perfect for sharing! Our entire party enjoyed their main courses- burgers, lamb, cod, and hamachi. The staff was also amazing. We waited about 20 minutes past our reservation time  for a better table and the owner was so accommodating- even gave us dessert on the house! Overall a great dining experience in SF
author: Taylor C.

description:
super weird experience. we had a 730 reservation, which i confirmed day of. we get there at 736, and they tell us that the table isn't ready. i asked how long it might be and they couldn't even give us a range. we waited 20min and asked again and they said "another 20min." we were seated 30min after our reservation time.

the food itself was great, though not quite a blowout. standouts include crispy poached chicken, the cod, and the octopus (though there was not much octopus -- my friend thought it was a potato and olive dish).

would consider coming back, but not top of our list.
author: Lilian W.

description: Really loud. Amazing food. Service needs improvement- starting with the host and bartender as you enter from either door.
author: Vicki L.

description: Came in for brunch and everything was delicious. Got the biscuits and chorizo gravy and it was ridiculous. I would drink that gravy if I could. Not too crowded either.
author: Karen F.

description: Had my cousin in town and decided to bring her and her friend here. We were absolutely blown away. Every single dish had amazing unique flavors that you can't get anywhere else. The starters were perfect to split between 3-6 people, and the main dishes were absolutely divine. The uni sauce on their steak dish was mind blowing, I almost wanted to lick the plate! Cool casual atmosphere, with dishes for vegetarians and meat lovers alike!Definitely my new favorite place in the Mission!
author: Sarah H.

description: First timer here! Came in yesterday for brunch and I left very satisfied. I ordered the fried egg sandwich and the tuna tostada and the only bummers were that my toast was too burnt and the tostadas were the size of 2 quarters put together. Service was fast and friendly, can't wait to check out their dinner menu!
author: Melissa M.

description: Excellent date night ambience, with warm lighting.  Friendly and accommodating staff.  We ordered and shared every small plate to get a good feel for the place.  They were all good to great, but I would definitely go back for the hamuchi, octopus and the hen of the woods.  Had a very reasonably priced white burgundy to wash it all down.
author: Cody M.

description: Wow, the food at this restaurant is amazing,  great interesting flavors and fresh high quality food.   Very reasonably priced.  There were 3 of us and we got a variety of small plates and shared them. Trying to decide what was my favorite dish is really hard,  the tostadas were so great, the endive arugula salad had an incredible dressing,  the octopus awesome, the then the sole special with fern fronds two other things I hadn't heard of was exceptional.  The service was great, the food came out so quickly and staff were friendly knowledgeable and very attentive. I can't wait to go back.
author: Jill S.

description: Great food and ambiance. The burger is the best I've had in sf. Would recommend this place to everyone.
author: Luis R.

description: Everything here was amazing. George at the bar was spot on with the wine pairing for each course. Highly recommend the food and staff here.
author: Micah B.

description: The waitstaff and management go over the top to make you feel welcomed. The kimchi eggs are to die for and the wine list is very unique. Definitely not to be missed!
author: Jess B.

description: I love this place! It feels comfortable enough to be my new happy hour hang but the food is so good I want to settle in for a long dinner. The owners are friendly and professional as are the staff. I can't wait to come back when their outdoor seating is open! Favorite dishes: Beef Tartare, Lamb Shank and Poached Chicken and Crispy Skin. Oh, and those Deviled Eggs!!
author: Andie C.

description: Came here the other night with some friends and left completely satisfied. We had pretty much every fish dish on the menu and all three desserts. Also some yummy cocktails but I can't recall which ones at the moment. Anyway, food and service were on point. A great stop on our San Fran food tour!
author: M H.

description:
It's been a while since I've tried a new neighborhood place in the Mission. It has a pretty spacious open feel despite it being a smaller place - I think the capacity said 49 people, but it felt bigger than this. I think it helps to have a bar area and reasonably spaced out tables.

It was pretty much full on a Sunday night, so it was good that we had a reservation via Open table.

Drinks: 
Beer and wine only. They have some pretty reasonably priced wines by the bottle - we had a French Cotes du Rhone/GSM and then the "Reckless Love" cabernet sauvignon/syrah blend from California.

Food: we did everything family style.
- Bacon and kimchee deviled eggs: subtle but present kimchee flavor, and the yolk was not overly creamy. The crispy bacon was a good pop of texture. Overall, a good starter, but my only complaint is that each half is $2.50.
- Tuna and uni tostada: 2 per order, with charred avocado and pickled red onion - lots of flavors and textures, none of which were dominating, and all of them complemented each other well
- Little gem salad: the pears were good, but it was a little over dressed for me 
- Beef tartare: the meat was a little tough, but it good flavor (mustard, black garlic), served with chips 
- Grilled Spanish octopus: with curried yucca and braised celery, leek togarashi. The octopus was charred nicely, and the curry was well balanced. Not surprisingly, the octopus was the standout part of the dish
- Roasted hen of the woods mushrooms: with pecorino and balsamic gastrique. The flavor was really good on this.
- Poached chicken: with crispy chicken skin over rice; the fermented soy bean salsa was awesome for flavor. This dish reminded me of Hainan chicken rice. We ended up liking it so much we got a 2nd order. The rice was very solid. 
- Pork chop: the butternut squash and bacon-brussels sprouts ragu were my favorite part; the pork itself was pretty tender and was well cooked 
- Pan roasted black cod: a small-ish piece. The delicata squash base was nice, but I couldn't taste the kimchee romesco much 
- Marin Sun Farms burger: white cheddar, bacon onion marmalade, charred scallion aioli, awesome fries. Since the chef was previously at Marlowe, and I loved their burger, I had to try this one, and it did not disappoint.

Dessert: 
- Dark chocolate and sea salt cookies: two chocolate chip cookies with sea salt; a little sweet for me, but everyone else liked them 

I was a little turned off by service, as our server was hard to flag down. However, everyone else working there did help to step in and do things like take our extra wine order, bring/pour the wine, refill waters, etc.  Everyone else in the staff was very warm and friendly, but I didn't get the feeling from our server. 

As for food, I would skip the cod and the salad. Everything else we got was worth trying at least once.  I will definitely come back for the tostadas, the poached chicken + crispy skin rice, and the burger.
author: Marilyn H.

description: Dinner here last week was awesome. We tried numerous items on the menu and all were outstanding! Highly recommend. Space was open, clean and I always love looking into the kitchen. The service was also close to perfection. I specifically thought Anthony had 5-star service and wanted to sing his praises.
author: Lily N.

description: I was enjoying the burger until I started biting into little bits of something that seemed like cardboard rather than beef. After several such bites, which I left in my napkin, I left the burger half finished. I doubt I'll order it again. Pity since it seemed very promising otherwise and I'm always on the lookout for a great burger.
author: H S.

description:
This place has all of my new favorites. I am a sucker for uni and bone marrow and both of these dishes are prepared in ways that have me falling in love with them all over again! The chicken liver is probably the best I have ever had! 

If you are not that adventurous there are plenty of staples that you will live too. The brussel sprout panzanella with beets will make anyone believe super foods are more than just a trend, they are delicious! The poached chicken with chicken skins is the sort of comfort food my mom wish she could make. And the beer and wine list had my mouth watering from the get go.
author: Dan V.

description: Their asparagus dish was very delicious ... for those that are gluten free just order it without bread crumbs. Service was wonderful.
author: Lisa R.

description:
My wife and I really enjoyed our dinner here.  We did a number of small dishes and found them all to be very good.  I think our favorite might have been the hamachi which was served with greens and in a light coconut milk sauce, but the poached chicken and crispy skin and the beef tartare were close seconds.  I appreciated that the creative dishes went beyond just tasting good.  The flavors and textures were complex.  The food was well plated and the waitstaff explained each dish as they brought it out.

By San Francisco standards, the meals are typically priced for this level of dining.  The restaurant has a good number of tables with good lighting and atmosphere.
author: Jim M.

description: Great new spot! A friend recommended I check this place out for dinner and can't rave enough about their food. The menu is diverse and sophisticated. We had a few different dishes and judging off those I'm sure everything on the menu is delicious, but we especially enjoyed the bacon kimchi deviled eggs and beef tartare. Nice, well-rounded wine selection and appreciated how they had them organized on their menu. The owners and staff are really friendly and were happy to answer our questions. The candles and modern chandeliers created a cool ambiance, makes for a great date location. Will definitely be back!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
We really liked Son's Addition, which is off to a great start despite some small hiccups. The restaurant is located in the South Mission - parking isn't easy (but where is it in SF?). We ordered three small plates and an entree. Really recommend the roasted hen of the woods mushrooms; our bone marrow with celery was pretty scant of the good stuff in the bone, so that's probably hit or miss. The brussel sprout panzanella was pretty tasty, but needed a hit of Maldon salt to bring out the flavors. The burger was beyond fantastic, as you'd expect from Marlowe alums. It was overcooked on the first try, but the revised burger was perfect, and the accompanying fries were fantastic. We also tried the mandarin orange gluten-free cake - great flavor but a little heavy for us. 

One quip on the service - no need to clear our table the second a dish looks almost finished.
author: MichLee A.

description: Enjoyed!  Here twice, easy parking and conversation.  The pork chop was a winner, as was the tuna and uni tostada.  Great service, casual atmosphere.  Will come again!
author: L. L.

description: My husband and I had a fantastic dinner here. It was simply amazing and we are not easily impressed. Best Lamb Shank I have ever had. Excellent service, friendly and professional staff. Can't wait to go back.
author: Mrs S.

description: Lamb shank is to die for. Order it. For dessert get the sabayon with pear. Didn't get to order the chicharones but saw it at the table next to me and had so much FOMO. The owners are very kind. We had to send a burger back because it had onion and my friend is allergic. They were very nice about it. I'd come back for sure.
author: Julie N.

description: Food was average, deviled eggs were definitely the highlight. We ordered deviled eggs, brussel sprouts, chicken and rice and lamb entree. lamb did not have any salt which made it really disappointing. Wines were mediocre. Overall I'd say don't bother.
author: Avani R.

description:
Son's Addition just started serving brunch on the weekends and I got to try it out on Day 2 before it got crowded with eager brunch-goers. Overall, I'll give it high marks for the taste and quality of the food. I definitely want to come back and check out the dinner menu. Here's what we had for brunch:
- Kimchi deviled eggs: Tasted pretty good but they were super small and $2.50 / half egg. I'll probably not order this again just because I thought it was too much to pay for a small bite.
- Seasonal scramble: Hearty portion, fully of seasonal vegetables and soft scrambled eggs. Not greasy and tasted good.
- Quiche - Good size slice of quiche with a mixed greens salad on the side. Fresh, cheesy and flavorful. Great crust.
- Malted waffle - When this arrived, we were quite disappointed by it's appearance - three waffle triangles with a dollop of butter and a pot of syrup. No berries or any other toppings, not even on the side. However, the waffle was the winner of the day for me. When something looks this plain, it better taste good and the malted waffle delivered for sure. Airy and flavorful. I never order waffles but I might go back to get this instead of having to steal from my mom's plate :)
Good food and I'll probably be back to check out the rest of the food soon.
author: Christina A.

description: Fabulous!  Everything on the menu was a perfect meld of flavors and textures.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  The setting comfortable.  Will be a new 'go to' for us!
author: Peggy M.

description:
Pros: 
Fun boisterous environment
Prompt pleasant service 

Cons:
Didn't love any of the food. It was all ok. 
Really disliked 60% of the wines. 
This is one of those Sf restaurants where you are basically on top of the people sitting next to you
It is really really loud in the restaurant so you are gonna be shouting at your dinner companion.
author: Amjad S.

description:
Enjoyed a wonderful dinner here last night. While they have only been open 5 weeks, they appeared to be running just fine with a completely full house. The environment is simple and tasteful.

We ordered the Pork Chop and the Lamb Which were both excellent. The pork chop was juicy without any overpowering ingredients as compliments on the plate. 

The lamb was absolutely fork tender and flavorful. My only critique was there was a little bit too much fresh mint included all over the dish and the intense flavor as well as the different texture didn't really work as well with the dish, in my opinion.

We didn't explore anything else on the menu but they have done a great job with what we sampled. I would absolutely recommend these two dishes if dining here.
author: Aaron L.

description: Creative, tasty flavors. Good service. Good wine. Classy place that isn't crazy expensive. Highly recommend.
author: Adam S.

description: Delicious and high quality food. Ordered some small bites and loved all of them. Very kind and professional personnel. Son's addition is a perfect and very welcome addition to the neighborhood!
author: Coen S.

description: Soooo many greats on this menu. I decided on the burger. Just damn delicious. Get the burger...I repeat.. get the burger. The place is gorgeously designed, the vibe is dope, the service impeccable, food is delicious. Can't wait to visit here again when I'm back in town. Make Son's Addition your newest addition of restaurants you frequent. One love.
author: Bryan K.

description: We enjoyed a very delicious meal on their second day of opening.  Every dish was thoughtfully executed. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped guide us through the many options. The waitstaff were highly attentive without disrupting our meal. We ended up getting several items to share. Some highlights: the hamachi appetizer, tuna tostada, deviled eggs, chopped salad, burger and pear dessert.  The waiter mentioned that they will eventually have outdoor seating which is ideal for this Mission corner spot at 24th St & Harrison.  5 stars for Son's Addition - a great addition to this neighborhood!
author: Myrick T.

description: Second time I went back to this place. The food is delicious, wine was excellent and great casual, fun ambiance. The restaurant has been open for couple months and already got to be my new fave place.
author: Daniela M.

description: Brunch was mediocre. Coffee is over priced for quantity. Really small cappuccino served in a large cup was $5. The coffee itself was quarter of the cup.
author: Ree M.

description: I came with 8 friends, and we ordered most of the menu. Every single dish was exquisite, and the service and ambience were lovely. We will definitely be back!
author: George H.

description: What a delightful addition to the neighborhood!  We visited last night for dinner and enjoyed warm service and excellent food at reasonable prices for a restaurant of its caliber.  Loved the panzanella and the sabayon--could not stop talking them both today.  We will be back for sure.
author: Laura S.

description: The whole meal was phenomenal. We started with the deviled eggs (MUST GET), then proceeded to split the poached chicken with coconut rice, roasted hen of the woods, black cod with sunchokes and the Brussels sprouts panzanela. We finished by splitting all three desserts. Each dish was unique, flavorful, and creative, while still having a hint of a soothing "comfort food" feel to it. The staff was incredibly attentive and friendly and their wine selection is fantastic and reasonably priced. All in all, this is one of the best meals I've had in San Francisco and this place is sure to be a staple to all future trips to NorCal. My only issue right now is that, as I type this review, I am dying for all of this food and regretting that it'll be at least a few more months before I can go here again. Alas, until then, I will just be dreaming of the deviled eggs and panzanela.
author: Devin T.

description: The hottest new spot in San Fran. I picked this spot for my girlfriend and I visiting from out of town. What a find!!! Food was insane and the service was awesome... Get in now before there's a line!
author: Charles B.

description: This place is awesome! The staff was super friendly and inviting and the beer draft selection was great. Nick the chef does an outstanding job in the kitchen, our lamb shank was delicious, tender, and super juicy. We also really enjoyed the chicken liver pate and Hamachi tostadas as well. Super hip interior with a casual vibe that makes everyone feel comfortable. Give them a try, you won't regret it!
author: Mark T.

description: Beautiful ambiance with amazing food!  Brussels sprouts were fantastic. Dessert was phenomenal. Def a place to try over and over!
author: Sarah G.

description: This is an amazing new restaurant with outstanding food and a fantastic staff. My wife and I went on a Monday evening and it was quite busy. The kimchi deviled eggs and little tostadas were very tasty. The bone marrow with roasted garlic on crostini was a real treat. Our server was very attentive and his wine recommendation could not have been better. The owners Anna and Nick have a beautiful restaurant and Nick knows how to balance flavors. All the plates we had were memorable and we will be returning again.
author: Tim S.

description: great great new place... more of a neighborhood gem. for evening dining, they could darken the lighting a bit
author: Banana J.

description: The dining experience at the new restaurant Son's Addition was an amazing experience much more than we expected! Starting with appetizers: Deviled eggs and The bone marrow while having a glass wine wetted our appetites, preparing us to venture on to the main dish.  I had the Pan Roasted Cod while my husband had the Lamb Shank.  We finished our dinner with a homemade chocolate and sea salt cookie which was to die for!  Between the warmth of restaurant and price of the dinners our over all dinning experience was a 10!  Totally recommend this restaurant to everyone who enjoys food!°
author: Saundra C.

description: Everything here was great! Came with a couple friends, shared a bottle of wine, amazing food- we shared everything and all plates we had were delicious! The tuna and Uni tostada appetizer and the crispy chicken coconut rice were my faves! Service was great and nice ambience and size of restaurant! Prices were not bad for how much food you got!
author: Aline G.

description: Loved this place! Came here with a group of 12 for my best friend's bachelorette this past weekend and was very impressed. The decor was simple but very inviting, and the food was great! The staff were very accomodating and diligent. This place is great to do family style, and we did just that! I loved the appetizers of bacon and kimchi deviled eggs and tuna & uni tostada, small plates of roasted bone marrow (the tomatillo sauce was great), the curried octopus, the poached chicken and crispy skin, and the chicken liver mousse which was surprisingly tasty. For the main plates, the braised lamb shank with polenta was perfectly cooked and matched and the burger was done amazingly. Hard to do a burger badly but this burger was great. Thanks to the staff for putting up with us! The next time I am in SF, I will definitely be back!
author: Candice M.

description: Our friends suggested checking out Son's Addition during a recent trip to San Francisco, and I am so happy we listened. Everything from the food, the vibe, to the incredibly friendly staff made it a perfect evening. So many great things to say. My favorites were the burger and the roasted hen of the woods!
author: Andrea I.

description: It doesn't matter how good food you serve or how nice you're trying to be (the host was not nice and suggested us grab a sit at the bar that was full) - if you can't hold a reservation, so your diners that arrived on time can sit on the time they plan, you don't deserve more than 1 star. Period.
author: Tamir A.

description: Really happy to see this in the neighborhood! Tried it out on a Sunday night and both service and food were excellent. Ahi tostadas were a favorite, but also shared the brussels sprouts and cod, which I really enjoyed as well. Excited to return.
author: Emily K.

description: Such friendly service!  And a wonderful meal as well.  We had the lamb leg, black cod, brussels sprouts (hello bread crumbs, get in my belly), uni/tuna tostada (nice use of cumin - added a great touch but couldn't taste the uni), and kimchee deviled eggs.  Looking forward to going back.
author: smegalandtootsie s.

description: Excellent dinner.  5 spiced lamb was awesome.  One of the best salads I've ever had (little gem).  Also uni tostada was great.  Good wine program as well.
author: Nari A.

description: I came here the first week the restaurant was open and wow, it was a hit.  We ordered several plates to share and each one was unique and well balanced.  I'll be back next week!
author: Arielle L.

description: Ohhh yes!  I could eat their roasted bone marrow and uni tostada every day.  The atmosphere, food and service was exceptional and I am already excited to go back.
author: Jenna B.
